segment.source: Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 Deployment Considerations
segment.target: Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 Deployment Considerations

segment.source: Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 Deployment Considerations
segment.target: Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 Deployment Considerations

segment.source: Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 Deployment Considerations
segment.target: Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 Deployment Considerations

segment.source: .NET Framework 3.5 is not included by default in Windows 10 or Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview, but you can download and deploy it for application compatibility.
segment.target: .NET Framework 3.5 is not included by default in Windows 10 or Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview, but you can download and deploy it for application compatibility.

segment.source: This section describes these deployment options.
segment.target: This section describes these deployment options.

segment.source: In this section:
segment.target: In this section:

segment.source: Deploy .NET Framework 3.5 by using Group Policy Feature on Demand setting
segment.target: Deploy .NET Framework 3.5 by using Group Policy Feature on Demand setting

segment.source: Deploy .NET Framework 3.5 by using Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM)
segment.target: Deploy .NET Framework 3.5 by using Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM)

segment.source: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Control Panel and Windows Update (Windows 8 only)
segment.target: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Control Panel and Windows Update (Windows 8 only)

segment.source: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using the Add Roles and Features Wizard
segment.target: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using the Add Roles and Features Wizard

segment.source: .NET Framework 3.5 deployment errors and resolution steps
segment.target: .NET Framework 3.5 deployment errors and resolution steps

segment.source: Introduction
segment.target: Introduction

segment.source: Windows 10 or Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview include .NET Framework 4.6, which is an integral Windows component that supports building and running the next generation of applications and web services.
segment.target: Windows 10 or Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview include .NET Framework 4.6, which is an integral Windows component that supports building and running the next generation of applications and web services.

segment.source: The .NET Framework provides a subset of managed types that you can use to create Windows Store apps for Windows by using C or Visual Basic.
segment.target: The .NET Framework provides a subset of managed types that you can use to create Windows Store apps for Windows by using C or Visual Basic.

segment.source: For more information, see .NET Framework.
segment.target: For more information, see .NET Framework.

segment.source: Only the metadata that is required to enable the .NET Framework 3.5 is contained in the default Windows image (sourcesinstall.wim).
segment.target: Only the metadata that is required to enable the .NET Framework 3.5 is contained in the default Windows image (sourcesinstall.wim).

segment.source: The actual binaries are not in the image.
segment.target: The actual binaries are not in the image.

segment.source: This feature state is known as disabled with payload removed.
segment.target: This feature state is known as disabled with payload removed.

segment.source: You can get the .NET Framework 3.5 payload files from Windows Update or the installation media in the sourcessxs folder.
segment.target: You can get the .NET Framework 3.5 payload files from Windows Update or the installation media in the sourcessxs folder.

segment.source: For more information, see Installing the .NET Framework 3.5.
segment.target: For more information, see Installing the .NET Framework 3.5.

segment.source: After the .NET Framework 3.5 feature is enabled, the files are serviced just like other operating system files from Windows Update.
segment.target: After the .NET Framework 3.5 feature is enabled, the files are serviced just like other operating system files from Windows Update.

segment.source: If you upgrade from Windows 7 (which includes .NET Framework 3.5.1 by default) to Windows 10, or from Windows Server 2008 R2 (which has .NET Framework 3.5.1 feature installed) to Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview, .NET Framework 3.5 is automatically enabled.
segment.target: If you upgrade from Windows 7 (which includes .NET Framework 3.5.1 by default) to Windows 10, or from Windows Server 2008 R2 (which has .NET Framework 3.5.1 feature installed) to Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview, .NET Framework 3.5 is automatically enabled.
